name: ICT, E-Governance, and Digital Literacy
description: A comprehensive collection of questions covering ICT fundamentals, e-Governance, digital security, and digital literacy.

subcategories.name: ICT Fundamentals and Tools
subcategories.description: Basic ICT concepts, hardware, software, and essential tools.

questions.question: What does ICT stand for in the context of public administration?
questions.explanation: ICT in public administration refers to Information and Communication Technology, which supports digital processes and service delivery.

questions.question: Which ICT tool is most commonly used for official communication in the civil service?
questions.explanation: Email remains the official communication tool in the civil service, ensuring record-keeping and formal correspondence.

questions.question: In ICT security, what does the acronym VPN stand for?
questions.explanation: VPN stands for Virtual Private Network, used to secure internet connections and protect data.

questions.question: Which ICT approach enables remote meetings in Nigeria's civil service?
questions.explanation: Video conferencing tools like Zoom and Teams allow civil servants to hold meetings remotely.

questions.question: Which ICT tool is used to protect systems from unauthorized access?
questions.explanation: A firewall acts as a barrier to control incoming and outgoing network traffic and prevent unauthorized access.

questions.question: What does 'cloud computing' allow government agencies to do?
options: Store and access data over the internet
questions.explanation: Cloud computing allows government agencies to store and access data over the internet instead of local servers.

questions.question: Which ICT innovation supports electronic filing systems in ministries?
questions.explanation: E-Registry is an ICT solution that replaces manual filing systems with digital document management.

questions.question: Which ICT term refers to malicious software that can damage systems?
questions.explanation: Malware refers to harmful software such as viruses, worms, and trojans.

questions.question: Which ICT tool helps in project management in ministries?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Project is commonly used for project planning and tracking in public administration.

questions.question: Which ICT device is used to scan documents into electronic format?
questions.explanation: Scanners convert paper documents into electronic formats for digital use.

questions.question: Which ICT device allows real-time communication across distances?
questions.explanation: Video conferencing tools enable real-time communication for governance meetings.

questions.question: Which ICT tool allows ministries to hold webinars?
questions.explanation: Zoom and similar platforms enable ministries to conduct virtual training and meetings.

questions.question: Which ICT platform supports the conduct of online meetings?
questions.explanation: Zoom is widely used in civil service for remote meetings.

questions.question: Which ICT device is used to project presentations in meetings?
questions.explanation: Projectors are used for presentations in government meetings.

questions.question: Which ICT device is essential for biometric data collection?
questions.explanation: Fingerprint scanners are used for biometric verification.

questions.question: What is the primary function of an operating system on a computer?
options: To control hardware and manage software resources
questions.explanation: The operating system controls hardware, manages software processes, and provides a platform for applications to run.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of input hardware?
questions.explanation: A keyboard is an input device used to send data or commands into a computer system.

questions.question: In computing, RAM is used for:
options: Temporary data storage while the computer is running
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is volatile memory used to store data that is actively being used or processed by the CPU.

questions.question: What is the function of a web browser?
options: To access and view websites on the internet
questions.explanation: A web browser is software designed to access and display information on the World Wide Web.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT an operating system?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Word is a word processing application, not an operating system.

subcategories.name: E-Governance and Digital Services
subcategories.description: E-Governance platforms, digital service delivery, and government ICT systems.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of e-Governance in Nigeria?
options: IPPS - Integrated Payroll and Personnel Information System
questions.explanation: The Integrated Payroll and Personnel Information System (IPPS) is a Nigerian e-Governance platform for managing salaries and personnel records.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Government Integrated Financial Management Information System (GIFMIS)?
questions.explanation: GIFMIS is used for electronic management of government finances to improve accountability and transparency.

questions.question: Which ICT concept emphasizes accessibility of government services online?
questions.explanation: E-Governance emphasizes delivering government services through digital platforms for easy access.

questions.question: Which ICT platform enables Nigerian citizens to access government services digitally?
questions.explanation: The gov.ng portal provides citizens access to digital government services.

questions.question: Which ICT tool is used in Nigeria for payroll automation?
questions.explanation: The Integrated Payroll and Personnel Information System (IPPS) automates payroll management in Nigeria's public service.

questions.question: Which of the following ICT applications is used in Nigerian elections?
questions.explanation: BVAS (Bimodal Voter Accreditation System) is used by INEC in Nigerian elections for voter authentication.

questions.question: Which is an example of ICT-assisted service delivery?
questions.explanation: Online tax filing reduces delays and improves efficiency in public service delivery.

questions.question: Which ICT innovation improves payroll integrity?
questions.explanation: IPPIS improves payroll integrity by eliminating ghost workers from government payrolls.

questions.question: Which ICT system integrates payroll with biometric verification?
questions.explanation: IPPIS integrates payroll systems with biometric verification for accuracy and transparency.

questions.question: Which ICT innovation enables citizens to pay taxes online?
questions.explanation: E-Tax Payment allows citizens to pay taxes electronically, improving revenue collection efficiency.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative integrates financial transactions of MDAs?
questions.explanation: GIFMIS centralizes financial transactions of MDAs for accountability and efficiency.

questions.question: Which ICT platform integrates payroll with personnel records?
questions.explanation: IPPIS integrates payroll and personnel records to eliminate ghost workers.

questions.question: Which ICT platform allows government services to be accessed via mobile devices?
questions.explanation: Mobile government applications provide access to public services via smartphones and tablets.

questions.question: Which ICT platform was introduced to improve Nigeria's ease of doing business?
options: Presidential Enabling Business Environment Council (PEBEC) portal
questions.explanation: The PEBEC portal simplifies regulatory processes and improves Nigeria's ease of doing business.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative promotes electronic land registration?
questions.explanation: E-Land Registry digitizes land records to improve transparency and reduce disputes.

questions.question: Which ICT platform supports electronic passport applications in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) Portal facilitates online passport applications.

questions.question: Which ICT platform promotes e-health services in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: E-Health platforms support electronic medical records and health service delivery.

subcategories.name: ICT Security and Cybersecurity
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity measures, data protection, threats, and security best practices.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of data protection in e-Governance?
questions.explanation: Encryption is a core method of data protection, securing official documents from unauthorized access.

questions.question: What does cyber security aim to protect?
questions.explanation: Cyber security protects ICT systems, networks, and data from unauthorized access or attacks.

questions.question: Which ICT term describes the practice of disguising communication to steal information?
questions.explanation: Phishing is an online scam where attackers impersonate trusted entities to steal sensitive data.

questions.question: Which ICT measure prevents unauthorized persons from accessing government systems?
questions.explanation: User authentication, including passwords and biometrics, prevents unauthorized system access.

questions.question: Which ICT security practice involves updating software regularly?
questions.explanation: Patching refers to applying updates to software to fix security vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Which ICT measure secures sensitive official emails?
questions.explanation: Encryption secures official emails by ensuring only intended recipients can read the content.

questions.question: Which ICT practice ensures strong password security?
options: Using long, complex, and unique passwords
questions.explanation: Strong passwords must be long, complex, and unique to prevent unauthorized access.

questions.question: Which ICT threat involves unauthorized access to systems?
questions.explanation: Hacking is an ICT threat where attackers gain unauthorized access to systems.

questions.question: Which ICT measure involves making backup copies of official data?
questions.explanation: Data backup ensures copies of data are available in case of system failure.

questions.question: Which ICT practice protects networks from malicious activities?
questions.explanation: Firewalls protect networks from malicious traffic and activities.

questions.question: Which ICT measure prevents unauthorized copying of sensitive files?
questions.explanation: Access control prevents unauthorized persons from copying, modifying, or accessing sensitive files.

questions.question: Which ICT tool is used to create secure electronic signatures?
questions.explanation: Digital signature software ensures documents are signed securely and verified electronically.

questions.question: Which ICT measure ensures that sensitive files cannot be altered by unauthorized persons?
questions.explanation: Data integrity checks prevent unauthorized modifications to sensitive files.

questions.question: What is cybersecurity?
options: Protecting physical documents in a safe
The practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks
questions.explanation: Cybersecurity involves protecting internet-connected systems, including hardware, software, and data, from cyber threats.

questions.question: What makes a strong password?
options: Using personal information like your name or birthdate
A combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters
questions.explanation: A strong password includes a mix of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters to enhance security.

subcategories.name: Digital Literacy and Innovation
subcategories.description: Digital literacy skills, innovation, problem-solving, and emerging technologies.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of ICT in governance?
questions.explanation: Digital exclusion is a challenge, not a benefit. ICT benefits governance by improving efficiency, transparency, and reducing paperwork.

questions.question: Which is an ICT challenge in Nigeria's civil service?
questions.explanation: Low ICT literacy among workers remains a key challenge in ICT adoption within Nigeria's civil service.

questions.question: What is the role of ICT in transparency?
options: Provide open access to government data
questions.explanation: ICT fosters transparency by making government data and processes accessible to citizens.

questions.question: Which ICT challenge affects rural access to e-Governance services?
questions.explanation: Low broadband penetration in rural areas limits access to e-Governance platforms.

questions.question: Which ICT tool is used to analyze large government datasets?
questions.explanation: Big Data Analytics is used to process and analyze large datasets for decision-making.

questions.question: Which ICT concept allows data to be stored across multiple servers?
questions.explanation: Cloud Storage allows data to be stored across servers accessible via the internet.

questions.question: Which ICT innovation uses Artificial Intelligence for chat-based public service delivery?
questions.explanation: Chatbots use AI to provide automated, chat-based service delivery in governance.

questions.question: Which ICT tool is essential for Geographic Information Systems (GIS)?
questions.explanation: GPS devices are essential for accurate mapping and GIS applications.

questions.question: Which ICT principle ensures that system downtime is minimized?
questions.explanation: Business continuity ensures systems remain functional and services continue during disruptions.

questions.question: Which ICT approach involves storing critical data in multiple locations?
questions.explanation: Data redundancy ensures critical information is stored in multiple locations for safety.

questions.question: What does 'information literacy' primarily involve?
options: The ability to use a computer
The ability to find, evaluate, and use information effectively
The ability to write computer programs
questions.explanation: Information literacy involves the ability to identify, locate, evaluate, and effectively use information.

questions.question: What is digital communication?
options: Sending letters through the postal service
The exchange of information through digital devices and platforms
questions.explanation: Digital communication involves the electronic exchange of information through digital devices and platforms.

questions.question: What is digital content?
options: Information in digital format, such as text, images, audio, and video
questions.explanation: Digital content refers to information that is stored in digital format and can be transmitted over computer networks.

questions.question: What is digital problem solving?
options: Using digital tools and technologies to identify and solve problems
questions.explanation: Digital problem solving involves using digital tools and technologies to identify, analyze, and solve problems.

subcategories.name: ICT Policy and Institutions
subcategories.description: ICT policies, regulations, institutions, and national ICT initiatives.

questions.question: Which Nigerian agency oversees the regulation of ICT and telecommunications?
questions.explanation: The Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) regulates ICT and telecommunications services in Nigeria.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative was launched to provide Nigerians with a unique national identification number?
questions.explanation: The National Identification Number (NIN) was introduced to uniquely identify citizens and residents in Nigeria.

questions.question: Which ICT-related policy was established to promote ICT growth in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Nigeria ICT Policy 2012 was established to promote ICT development and application in governance.

questions.question: What is the role of NITDA in Nigeria's ICT sector?
questions.explanation: The National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) promotes ICT policy and monitors its implementation.

questions.question: Which Nigerian initiative helps in centralizing biometric data of citizens?
questions.explanation: The Bank Verification Number (BVN) system centralizes citizens' biometric and financial identity data.

questions.question: Which ICT law in Nigeria focuses on cybercrime prevention?
questions.explanation: The Cybercrime Act 2015 addresses cybercrimes such as hacking, identity theft, and cyber fraud.

questions.question: Which ICT platform ensures electronic procurement in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: NOCOPO was developed for open contracting and electronic procurement processes in Nigeria.

questions.question: Which Nigerian ICT initiative is designed to promote cashless policy?
questions.explanation: The CBN Cashless Policy promotes electronic transactions and reduces reliance on physical cash.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative provides biometric verification for bank accounts?
questions.explanation: The Bank Verification Number (BVN) provides biometric identity verification for Nigerian bank accounts.

questions.question: Which ICT policy ensures safe handling of citizens' digital data?
questions.explanation: The Nigeria Data Protection Regulation (NDPR) mandates safe handling of personal digital data.

questions.question: Which ICT system is used by banks to verify customers' identity?
questions.explanation: The Bank Verification Number (BVN) ensures accurate identification in banking services.

questions.question: Which ICT platform supports Nigeria's Treasury Single Account (TSA)?
questions.explanation: GIFMIS provides the platform for implementing the Treasury Single Account in Nigeria.

questions.question: Which Nigerian ICT agency promotes ICT innovation?
questions.explanation: The National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) drives ICT innovation in Nigeria.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative supports Nigeria's digital economy policy?
options: National Digital Economy Policy and Strategy (NDEPS)
questions.explanation: NDEPS was introduced to support Nigeria's transition into a digital economy.

questions.question: Which ICT law criminalizes online fraud in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Cybercrime Act 2015 criminalizes cyber fraud, hacking, and related offences.

questions.question: Which ICT agency regulates telecommunication operators in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) regulates telecom operators.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative provides a unified system for identity management?
questions.explanation: The National Identification Number (NIN) provides a unified identity management system.

questions.question: Which ICT policy promotes ICT use across all government services?
questions.explanation: The National ICT Policy 2012 promotes ICT adoption across sectors.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative reduces cash transactions in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The CBN Cashless Policy promotes electronic transactions instead of physical cash.

questions.question: Which ICT system ensures transparent public procurement in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: NOCOPO promotes transparency in Nigeria's public procurement.

questions.question: Which ICT platform was introduced to monitor MDAs' financial transactions?
questions.explanation: GIFMIS allows monitoring and auditing of MDA financial transactions.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative supports Nigeria's Smart Government vision?
questions.explanation: The E-Government Master Plan lays out Nigeria's vision for Smart Government through ICT adoption.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative promotes inclusive access to ICT in underserved communities?
questions.explanation: USPF promotes ICT access in underserved and rural communities across Nigeria.

questions.question: Which ICT challenge is caused by dependence on imported hardware and software?
questions.explanation: Digital dependency makes Nigeria reliant on foreign ICT tools and reduces local innovation.

questions.question: Which ICT system helps track and reduce ghost pensioners?
questions.explanation: IPMIS was developed to manage pension records and eliminate ghost pensioners.

questions.question: Which ICT law mandates service providers to retain traffic data for security purposes?
questions.explanation: The Cybercrime Act 2015 requires service providers to retain traffic data for national security.

questions.question: Which ICT platform facilitates electronic customs clearance in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: NICIS II supports electronic customs clearance and trade facilitation.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative is aimed at promoting digital literacy in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: NITDA's Digital Literacy Program aims to promote digital literacy across Nigeria.

subcategories.name: ICT in Government and Elections
subcategories.description: ICT applications in elections, governance processes, and public service delivery.

questions.question: Which of the following ICT applications is used in Nigerian elections?
questions.explanation: BVAS (Bimodal Voter Accreditation System) is used by INEC in Nigerian elections for voter authentication.

questions.question: Which ICT platform supports electronic voter registration in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The INEC Voter Enrolment Device (IVED) supports biometric voter registration electronically.

questions.question: Which ICT initiative supports Nigeria's population census?
questions.explanation: E-Census is designed to improve accuracy and efficiency in Nigeria's population census.

questions.question: Which ICT system helps monitor government performance dashboards?
questions.explanation: E-M&E systems track progress on government programs and projects in real time.

questions.question: Which ICT innovation promotes electronic justice delivery?
questions.explanation: E-Court platforms allow digital case filing and management, improving judicial efficiency.

questions.question: Which ICT platform is used for online civil service recruitment tests?
questions.explanation: CBT (Computer-Based Test) platforms are used for online recruitment examinations.

questions.question: Which ICT device is used for biometric verification of voters?
questions.explanation: BVAS (Bimodal Voter Accreditation System) is used by INEC for biometric voter verification.

questions.question: Which ICT platform ensures electronic procurement processes in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Nigerian Open Contracting Portal (NOCOPO) supports e-Procurement.

questions.question: Which ICT innovation supports digital payments for government services?
questions.explanation: Remita is a Nigerian payment gateway that facilitates electronic payments for government services.

subcategories.name: Digital Literacy and Skills
subcategories.description: Digital literacy competencies, information evaluation, and digital communication skills.

questions.question: Which of the following sources is generally considered most reliable for government information?
questions.explanation: Official government websites (.gov.ng) are authoritative sources for verified information and policies.

questions.question: What is the best way to verify information found online?
options: Only check the first search result
questions.explanation: Verifying information across multiple reliable sources helps ensure its accuracy and reliability.

questions.question: Which of the following is an indicator that an online source may be unreliable?
options: Frequent grammatical errors and lack of citations
questions.explanation: Lack of citations, errors, or missing author credentials often indicate unreliable sources.

questions.question: In data literacy, what does 'data validation' mean?
options: Checking data for accuracy and consistency
questions.explanation: Data validation ensures that data is accurate, complete, and meets quality standards before use.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of asynchronous communication?
questions.explanation: Email is an example of asynchronous communication as it doesn't require the participants to be present at the same time.

questions.question: What does 'netiquette' refer to in online communication?
options: Polite and respectful behavior on the internet
questions.explanation: Netiquette means proper and respectful conduct in online interactions.

questions.question: Which email field allows you to send a copy to someone without revealing it to others?
questions.explanation: The BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) field lets you send a message copy without other recipients knowing.

questions.question: Which of the following should you avoid in formal email communication?
questions.explanation: Emojis and slang reduce professionalism and clarity in formal emails.

questions.question: Which platform is best suited for hosting virtual meetings within the public service?
questions.explanation: Zoom and Teams are secure platforms for official meetings and webinars.

questions.question: The term 'cloud collaboration' means:
options: Working together using internet-based tools and storage
Working offline using shared flash drives
Using only local software for teamwork
questions.explanation: Cloud collaboration allows users to share and edit documents in real time from any location.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a best practice in virtual meetings?
options: Muting your microphone when not speaking
questions.explanation: Interrupting others disrupts communication flow and shows lack of meeting etiquette.

questions.question: Which of these platforms allows for document co-editing in real time?
questions.explanation: Google Docs enables real-time document editing and commenting by multiple users.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of digital collaboration tools in the workplace?
questions.explanation: Digital tools streamline communication and teamwork, improving overall productivity.

questions.question: When sharing sensitive documents via email, what security measure should be applied?
questions.explanation: Password-protecting attachments helps secure confidential information from unauthorized access.

questions.question: What is the best way to manage group tasks digitally?
options: Using task management tools like Trello or Asana
questions.explanation: Tools like Trello and Asana help assign, monitor, and track tasks efficiently online.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of effective online communication?
questions.explanation: Clarity and brevity are essential for ensuring messages are understood in digital platforms.

questions.question: Which protocol is commonly used for sending emails?
questions.explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is the standard for sending email messages across the internet.

questions.question: What is the main difference between synchronous and asynchronous communication?
options: Synchronous occurs in real time; asynchronous allows delayed responses
Asynchronous requires video calls; synchronous uses chat
Synchronous is offline; asynchronous is online
They both mean the same thing
questions.explanation: Synchronous communication (e.g., Zoom calls) is real-time, while asynchronous (e.g., email) happens with time delays.

questions.question: What does 'CC' stand for in email communication?
questions.explanation: CC means 'Carbon Copy', used to send the same email to additional recipients for their information.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of asynchronous communication?
questions.explanation: Emails allow delayed responses, making them asynchronous communication.

questions.question: Which online collaboration tool allows real-time project tracking and task assignment?
questions.explanation: Trello is used for visual project management, helping teams track tasks and responsibilities in real time.

questions.question: Which of the following practices supports good digital teamwork?
options: Setting clear roles and deadlines in shared platforms
questions.explanation: Clearly defined roles, responsibilities, and timelines promote efficiency in team collaboration.

questions.question: Which platform allows multiple users to collaborate on spreadsheets simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Google Sheets enables real-time editing, sharing, and commenting by multiple users online.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using instant messaging apps in government workplaces?
options: To provide real-time communication and coordination among staff
questions.explanation: Instant messaging facilitates quick information sharing and teamwork among government staff.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best practice when participating in online group discussions?
questions.explanation: Active listening and constructive participation improve online collaboration and mutual understanding.

questions.question: Which video conferencing etiquette improves meeting professionalism?
options: Testing your audio and video before the meeting
questions.explanation: Testing equipment and joining on time ensure smooth and professional virtual meetings.

questions.question: Which of the following helps to avoid miscommunication in digital correspondence?
options: Using clear subject lines and structured messages
Sending all details in one long paragraph
questions.explanation: Clear formatting and subject lines improve message comprehension and professionalism.

questions.question: Which of these actions demonstrates respect in online communication?
options: Using courteous language and acknowledging others' opinions
questions.explanation: Courteous and inclusive language promotes mutual respect in online spaces.

questions.question: Which of the following tools is most appropriate for internal organizational communication?
questions.explanation: Slack and Teams are designed for secure, efficient communication within professional environments.

questions.question: When using collaborative documents, what feature helps track changes made by team members?
questions.explanation: Version tracking ensures accountability and transparency in document editing.

questions.question: Which of the following actions enhances digital collaboration in hybrid workplaces?
options: Restricting communication to office hours only
Using shared calendars and digital task boards
questions.explanation: Shared calendars and digital boards synchronize team activities across physical and remote settings.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using collaborative email groups in ministries or agencies?
options: They send messages to all team members simultaneously
They require manual resending of messages
questions.explanation: Group email lists facilitate consistent communication across departments and units.

questions.question: Which statement best describes digital collaboration in public service?
options: Working individually without shared digital tools
Using technology to coordinate and deliver services efficiently
Delegating all ICT work to external consultants
questions.explanation: Digital collaboration enables civil servants to share knowledge, coordinate tasks, and improve service delivery through ICT tools.
